Getting Started

Looking for what‚Äôs new in v2? Head over here.

New to swup? Little intro:

  • It‚Äôs just ridiculously easy to use, even for beginners.
  • Define as many containers to replace as you want! You can tell swup to replace even the smallest parts of the page, so you can work with the rest for your animation.
  • Use swup events to run your JavaScript, trigger analytics, close sidebars or anything you need‚Ä¶
  • Forget about timing. swup detects the end of your animations and controls the whole lifecycle of transition automatically.
  • Don‚Äôt worry about browser history‚Ä¶ swup takes care of it, changes the url when it‚Äôs needed and preserves browser native behavior on popState events.
  • Has some cool additional features for even better experience like cache, smart preload without DDOSing your server, badass smooth ‚Äúacceleration based‚Äù scroll control, helpful debug mode, or support for forms.

In case you like to do your animations in JavaScript, you may want to check out js-plugin.

If you‚Äôre having trouble implementing swup, checkout Common Issues, Closed Issues or open a new one.

Swup is released under MIT license.
